ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: William was very approachable, flexible and helpful. He gave great feedback.

This class covers all the little things that are very important when it comes to how we present our work, ourselves, and how we interact and communicate with others in a work setting. William Vance is very knowledgeable and helpful.

William Vance is an incredible professor. This class was extremely beneficial for me. Professor Vance was able to bring direct examples into his lectures and show why the lessons he was teaching were important for us as graduate students and professionals. He was very open to student feedback and made several small changes to classwork and class time based on this feedback. Professor Vance was very approachable and kind and always open to speak with a student.
This is really helpful for professional communication.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Full of activities and practice! Instant feedback!
The interactive nature of the course exercises.
Lots of hands on learning and feedback

Having the opportunity to be given one on one feedback on presentation skills, elevator speeches, writing, and our role in a meetings were all very valuable to me. The tips we learned on how to facilitate a conference panel were also very useful! The workload was very reasonable which I appreciated since it was an extra class on top of a full course load.
The excercises were super useful for practice.

Watching our filmed presentations and group meetings was eye-opening and making comments using the online software was helpful, especially for remembering what we need to work on moving forward. The one-on-one work we did during class time, when we would then switch partners and continue to work, helped with getting over any nerves with presenting myself and realizing that we are all working on the same issues and dealing with the same kinds of nerves. Learning from our peers was a great way to help us learn to be better communicators.
The abolity to take ownership of the "lessons" amd oersonalize my focus towards my weaknesses/challenges/professional needs.
Learning how to develop key talking points

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I wish more reading/recommended materials could be shared via Canvas.
none!
Can't think of anything!

I wish this course had a few more sessions, so that we could practice things a few more times. I feel like I just got a taste, which was super useful, but would have loved to practice in order to get things really cemented in my mind.
I really wouldn't change anything.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Highly linked.
Good breakout sessions and exercises. Tied directly to lecture material
great idea to break into small groups, I really like the way this was done.
Excellent.
Yes

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course enhanced my communication skills, which serves as a multiple to my previous study and professional life. Very down-to-earth, very helpful and inspiring!
Learning communication skills is important for everyone no matter the field
Helped me a lot with presentation skills
All of the skills we learned in this class can be applied to my future career and many of the skills we learned can be applied to my current job search.
Everyone should take this course, no matter your specific program of study!
I think every F&ES student should take this course, it helps us be better communicators, which is especially important in our field!
I believe all FES students should take this class.
Helpful to build communication skills

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Noticing my poor performance in some item in the communication ability test.
To practice public speaking and gain more tools for effective oral communication.
To gain confidence when presenting and to learn some negotiation skills.
I am working on improving my presentation skills and also on becoming a better public speaker and more articulate person overall.
Curiosity
Needed to improve my communication skills

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: I hope so, but I still need further practice.
Met expectations. Learned more than expected.
yes
Yes! The class was short but sweet, and jam packed with useful tools and takeaways.
Yes!
Exceeded
Yes
Yes!

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It was good to switch up groups every week.
group work was great!
Group work exercises were super helpful. I loved seeing my classmates' interpretation of prompts, as well as learning from their strengths and experiences.
Mentioned in my previous response. I enjoyed the group work and thought it was greatly beneficial.
It helped to be evaluated by other students.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Very useful.
Light workload course that's fun and useful!
Everyone should consider taking this course. I guarantee you will find it helpful for any future job. The workload is also very doable and it's only a few classes!
Take this course!
Do it!!! Maybe more than once. And ASAP in your degree
Very useful in communication skills.

The class is excellent, you need to be willing to be uncomfortable, but it doesn't make us too uncomfortable and provides a safe space to discuss our weaknesses and how to improve. Also it's key to keep practicing the tips they taught us, which I am also trying hard to b/c it's easy to be lazy and just go with my usual communication style.
